alert.note: Alert for Benton; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:51AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Weakley, north central Benton and Henry Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 450 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Paris Landing State Park, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paris, Paris Landing State Park, Cottage Grove, Puryear, Jones Mill, Foundry Hill, Old Springville, Crossland, Buchanan, India, Mill Creek, Osage, Sunnyside, Whitlock, Porter Court, Conyersville, Pine Hill and Big Sandy Unit Tennessee National Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for west Tennessee.
